page.title: 03NWWA: ABBEYSTEAD WATER PLANT
page.content: As part of a scheme completed in the 1970s to increase the supply of water to the Fylde, the North-West Water Authority built a tunnel to divert water from the Lune into the Wyre. The outflow chambers from the tunnel lie just below Abbeystead Dam and here on the north bank is an underground pumping station or valvehouse. In May 1984 a group from St.Michaels-on-Wyre, worried about recent flooding on their stretch of the river, was being shown round the plant by NWWA officials when a violent explosion took place,killing 16 people and injuring 28. No-one local was hurt but many were involved in the rescue work. The explosion was caused by the build-up of methane gas in the unventilated tunnel.During late 1985 an extensive seismic survey is being carried out in order to examine the extent of the methane deposits.
